channel.title: Amplifier not outputting anything to speakers
channel.description:
Hello.
I just installed a new deck into my car ([url=http://www.crutchfield.ca/Sony_CDX_GT430IP_CD_Receiver_p/158GT430IP.htm]View[/url])
Now, I purchased a small 240w. amp ([url=http://www.pyramidcaraudio.com/itempage.asp?model=PB110PX]View[/url]). I installed it in the boot of the car. I grounded it, ran the power & remote leads. That's all working perfectly.
Then I hooked up the two RCA cables to the Sub/Rear RCA port on the deck, and the low input on the aplifier. This is also working as when one is unplugged on either end the amp will shut down until the connection is re-established.
Now, here's the problem. I have two oval (Not 100 % sure of the size, their not huge or anything) speakers that I am hooking up. I have cut the proper length of speaker wire, I have added clips for the end to connect to the 'ports' on the amplifier. I checked the speakers (As they are mounted in box's) to make sure the input from the box to the speaker is proper, and both are. But, when hooked up, and the amp is powered on, and music is playing, nothing comes out of these speakers.
I have tested the speakers on my home theater, and they work fine there. I have also tried changing settings on the deck (Changed from sub to rear, then vice versa) but that did not work either.
Does anyone have any idea what exactly is going on?
Thanks for reading.

item.title: Amplifier not outputting anything to speakers
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:299921”]It sounds like it isn’t the speakers, but a problem with the amp. I have a vague memory of a problem like this with my amp in high school, I think it had something to do with either the remote on wire had to had a constant 12V or it had to just have 12V for a second, and I had it hooked up the wrong way.

Test that you are getting power through the main lead with a tester.[/quote]

Yea, I think that this may be the cause of the problem. I am going to re-wire everything tomorrow.

Thanks for your replies.

Read full topic
item.source: Amplifier not outputting anything to speakers

item.title: Amplifier not outputting anything to speakers
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It sounds like it isn’t the speakers, but a problem with the amp. I have a vague memory of a problem like this with my amp in high school, I think it had something to do with either the remote on wire had to had a constant 12V or it had to just have 12V for a second, and I had it hooked up the wrong way.

Test that you are getting power through the main lead with a tester.

Read full topic
item.source: Amplifier not outputting anything to speakers

item.title: Amplifier not outputting anything to speakers
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Try hooking another set of speakers up to it, maybe your amp isn’t working?

I did, same thing.

Question: Could the remote be feeding it a bit of power to turn the LED on? Maybe the main power lead has a problem with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Amplifier not outputting anything to speakers
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

Moparisthebest:

You are sure the speakers are connected to the speaker out, instead of the high input?

Yep.

The high input is on the other side, and is in the form of a plug.

Read full topic
